title: Rosie the Riveter WWII Home Front National Historical Park: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety       Vehicle Safety Please do not leave visible items in your vehicle, regardless of value or where you are parking. We are not responsible for lost or stolen property.   Finding Sites In Richmond There are multiple historic sites throughout the city of Richmond that are part of the WWII Home Front. Please make sure to pick up a map from the Visitor Education Center in order to drive to each spot in a safe and timely manner. Not all sites on the map are open to the public. You may contact the visitor center during operating hours if you need help with directions. Our number is: 510-232-5050 Ext. 0   Waterfront Location Please check the weather and dress appropriately before arriving to the park. You may check the "Weather" page on our site to get an average look at temperatures.  Sun Safety Sunblock can be helpful if spending time outdoors.   Handrails Please remember to use handrails when available. Steps can be slippery due to weather conditions and moisture.  Red Oak Victory Ship During rain, the ship will be closed for safety reasons.
